content:
Hi team, mirroring here this topic:
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/131828-t-compiler/topic/Hosting.20meetings.20agenda.20on.20a.20git.20repo

Short version: I've been taken care of the T-compiler agenda meetings for some time, it would help me if I could host the meetings agenda markdown files on a git repo.

I was thinking to something under rust-lang/* (example rust-lang/compiler-team) but I'm not sure who is managing that repo and what degree of effort would be to give write access to a repo under rust-lang/*, possibly to multiple people of WG-prioritization

What would the simplest solution for everyone would look like? :-) I mean, I can host these files on any git repo but my point was that it would be beneficial for them to be public (not so different from the weekly perf logs)
(fwiw pnkfelix and Jack Huey expressed interest in this)
@apiraino if the compiler team is fine with you all putting notes there, there is no problem granting the wg write access to it
I understand you folks at T-infra take permissions seriously (and fully agree). Is there way to give the minimum amount of access for such a task?
likely write access to the repository, which is the least amount of perms needed to push code
@pnkfelix @Wesley Wiser is granting wg-prioritization write access to the compiler-team repo ok for y'all?
Ok with me :thumbs_up:
